intro: Brizochloa, commonly known as the needle grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. These plants are native to various regions of Africa, particularly in the southern part of the continent. Brizochloa species are typically characterized by their slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. They often grow in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The flowers are small and clustered, forming dense inflorescences that contribute to their ornamental appeal.
